critique: The executive order seems to be a formal document about transferring functions and abolishing offices. It does not seem to explicitly aim to evoke any particular emotion. However, one could argue that there might be a subtle element of relief or hope (joy) associated with the end of the war and the subsequent reorganization. There might also be a tinge of sadness related to the abolishment of the Office of Economic Stabilization, but it's very minimal. Surprise, fear, and disgust are unlikely to be relevant here.
